article:
A student was one day taking a walk with a professor. The professor was very popular with students for his ways of   _  . As they were walking, they saw lying in the path a pair of old shoes, which they   _   belonged to a poor man who was working in a field close by.
The student turned to the professor, saying, "Let's play a   _   on him: we'll hide his shoes, and hide ourselves behind those bushes, and wait to see his   _   when he cannot find them."
The professor said, "We should   _   amuse ourselves at the expense of the poor. You are   _  , and may give yourself a much greater pleasure   by means of   helping the poor man. Let's put a coin into each shoe, and then we will   _   ourselves and watch how the
  _   affects him." The student did so. Before long, the poor man came across the
  _   to the path where he had left his coat and shoes.
While putting on his coat he   _   his foot into one of his shoes, feeling something
  _  . He bent down to see what it was, and found the coin.   _   and wonder appeared on his face. He stared at the coin, turning it around, then looked around on all sides without
  _   anyone. He put the money into his pocket, and   _   to put on the other shoe, and his surprise was   _   upon finding the other coin.
He fell upon his   _  , looked up to heaven, and let out a sincere thanksgiving in which he spoke of his wife, sick and   _  , and his children who   _   bread, whom this timely help would save from dying.
The student stood there deeply affected, his eyes filled with tears. "Are you not much better
  _   than if you had played a trick?" said the professor.
